name: enthronement
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the act of putting a king, queen, etc. through the ceremony of sitting on a throne (= chair used in ceremonies) in order to mark the official beginning of their period in power: The exhibit included the dress worn by the Queen during her crowning and enthronement. He attended the enthronement of the Pope.
the act of giving someone a position where they are or seem extremely important: Analysts expect the Prime Minister to shuffle the cabinet once again, now that his enthronement is complete. Her life seemed enviable, with her enthronement as a national treasure. See
enthrone
More examplesFewer examplesThe Dalai Lama was joined at celebrations marking the anniversary of his enthronement.Amaterasu, the great female ancestor of the emperors, bestows divinity on each new emperor on the night of his enthronement. Stephen Hawking's deserved enthronement as a king of four-dimensional space-time
